intro: Hieracium protractidens, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as fruits. Hieracium protractidens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in temperate climates.
